snippet: Pia Sundhage took over a United States women’s national team in crisis and led it to two Olympic gold medals and a second-place finish at the 2011 World Cup.
abstract: Jere Longman On Soccer column lauds soccer coach Pia Sundhage, who took over a United States women’s national team in crisis and led it to two Olympic gold medals and a second-place finish at the 2011 World Cup.
lead_paragraph: Pia Sundhage took over a United States women’s national team in crisis and led it to two Olympic gold medals and a second-place finish at the 2011 World Cup.

headline.print_headline: A Pitch-Perfect Voice for a Team in Need of Fine-Tuning
headline.seo: Sundhage Was Pitch-Perfect Voice for U.S. Soccer Team
headline.main: A Pitch-Perfect Voice for a Team in Need of Fine-Tuning
